column5: The bridge located between Gullrock Lake and Pakwash that carries Hwy 105 across the Chukuni River has washed out. Here are the details: https://kenoraonline.com/articles/re...BIRBqFrLqMTidk
Thats not a good thing for the area. Doesn't sound like anybody was injured so thats a good thing.
Hope the major is right cause tge water rolling through isn't going to stop soon.It comes from miles away and builds up.no bridges or culvert are safe right
Glad no one was injured, It looks like the drought is over!

Not to be picky since that still cuts off road access to Gullrock and Red Lake on 105 - but that is not the 105 bridge over the Chukuni. We fish Pakwash and have navigated up to the falls many times on the Chukuni and the photo and the wash out must be where 105 goes over Caribou Creek about a half mile south of the bridge over the Chukuni. The 105 bridge over the Chukuni was replaced about 10 yrs ago with an 84-meter single span steel girder bridge - and if it had been washed out, it would take a LONG time to fix. Hopefully they will have this one fixed as quickly as they say - the article is talking about days..
Not picky.your right.Hope it getß fixed fast.Right now its raining steady so not gooď.Lots of places all over are flooding
